greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The Goldbach permutation: take A065305, cross out repetitions and subtract 2 from each term.
comment: The sequence would be a permutation of the naturals if Goldbach's conjecture holds (Every even integer n greater than two is the sum of two primes). Inverse: A065307
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: f (x:xs) ys = if x `elem` ys then f xs ys else x : f xs (x:ys)
results.author: Klaus Strassburger (strass(AT)ddfi.uni-duesseldorf.de), Oct 29 2001
